heading: Greeks and Implied Volatilty
content: The Greeks are measures that describe the sensitivity of an Option's price to various factors like underlying price changes (Delta), time decay (Theta), volatility (Vega), and interest rates (Rho), while Implied Volatility (IV) represents the market's expectation of the underlying asset's volatility over the life of the Option.

featureShortDescription.01: Concepts on Greeks, IV, and IV modeling
featureShortDescription.02: Implementation of IV and Greeks as LEAN indicators
